(And you‚Äôre not being honest about it, you cowardly removed your post instead of posting an edit acknowledging your wrongdoing). 

Again, if you don‚Äôt want me to comment, then don‚Äôt reply. I told you that last time. Your ego doesn‚Äôt let you just shut up and take responsibility for your actions. It‚Äôs *always* someone else‚Äôs fault. Just like it‚Äôs my fault you keep replying. Pathetic.

Edit: that bachelor Chris whatever-his-name-was was driving in the middle of nowhere drunk and he hit a 70 year old farmer on his tractor‚Äîkilling him. He was in the middle of buttfuck nowhere at night and he robbed a family of their grandpa. 

Think about that next time you decide to be an active loser. And if you did have experience dealing with people like me, maybe you‚Äôd actually have a life instead of living off your parent‚Äôs spare change as a near 30 year old man. Don‚Äôt come to Reddit for pity.

author: versacek9
body:
I live in fucking CA, the most expensive state. I didn‚Äôt get help with living costs, I never got help with rent or food, but somehow I could manage to afford it. 

Quit coming to reddit and playing victim when depression isn‚Äôt your problem. You have depression because of the world you set up for yourself. I‚Äôm willing to bet you were living with your parents before COVID hit.

It doesn‚Äôt matter, if you crash into a pole your still affecting the EMTs that you can‚Äôt afford‚Äîthat‚Äôs how fucking selfish and delusional you are‚Äîyou don‚Äôt even consider the well being of the first responders who have to deal with your pathetic ass afterwards. 

You deserve this hard type of talk because you need to hear it. Quit feeling sorry for yourself. You put yourself first in your misery anyways, do something for yourself. I come in to r/depression to empathize and help but I can‚Äôt empathize with you and this type of talk is helping you. You‚Äôre fucking pathetic‚Äîgrow the fuck up.

If you don‚Äôt want a reply, the dont reply. This is part of the growing up process.

author: versacek9
body:
My brother is an EMT. I‚Äôm not part of the people judging you‚Äôre part of the people drinking and driving. 

Don‚Äôt shy away from the problem and deflect when YOURE in the wrong. I fucking hate people who use depression to justify being a shitty person.

If you‚Äôre old enough to buy alcohol, you‚Äôre old enough to move out and buy yourself a spot where you can drink. You‚Äôre not even trying to help yourself and automatically you put others at risk. I don‚Äôt feel bad for you.

author: versacek9
body: Thank you so much, I really appreciate it.

author: versacek9
body: Thank you so much for that

author: versacek9
body:
I‚Äôm not black, but I have scary, chronic depression too‚Äîeverything going on is affecting me so deeply, I can‚Äôt even begin to understand with how overwhelmed  you must be feeling, but you‚Äôre so brave for making it this far, man. 

You might have to work twice as hard, but you‚Äôre twice as strong than the rest of us and you are admired and appreciated for it.

And you know what? If you don‚Äôt feel like being strong, that‚Äôs okay‚Äîplease protect yourself. Stay in bed, sleep in, watch something you enjoy and just take care of yourself. You have to make sure you‚Äôre okay, before anything can be okay. 

You can do this. I think all of this global discomfort is going to bring about some serious change, for the better. 

Take care of yourself and we care about you<3

author: versacek9
body:
I‚Äôm so glad because everyone on this post would all give you a hug irl if we could <3 

Be selfish and take care of yourself <3 

You are doing enough and you are worthy <3

We love you, stay safe, man. <3

author: versacek9
body:
I don‚Äôt think it does get better‚ÄîI think at best we learn how to react/manage differently. 

If anything,from what I‚Äôve experienced just in my 26 years, it just gets worse. 

Everything you thought you had sense of‚Äîfamily, life path, relationship‚Äîgets fucked somehow, and I don‚Äôt now if it like this for anyone else, but it all exponentially starts to get more fucked in a very short amount of time‚Äîwhat am I talk it about, it‚Äôs 2020: we‚Äôre literally living it.

author: versacek9
body: Same here. Absolutely crushed that I can never go back to my college days. I graduated 4 years ago :(

author: versacek9
body:
I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable opening up to my parents about it because they always mitigated it and they would absolve themselves of any guilt‚Äîthey definitely don‚Äôt like to be reminded of their messy divorce and the after affects. 

It wasn‚Äôt until I told them I had just been involuntarily committed for 72hrs for a suicide attempt, did they *begin* to take me seriously. 

For reference I‚Äôve been depressed my entire life, became aware of it at 18 and didn‚Äôt confide in my parents until I was 25. I‚Äôm 26 now. 

I think Boomers tend to be narcissistic as a whole generation, and to acknowledge that your kid is messed up is to acknowledge that you messed up somewhere along the line‚Äîwhich they really don‚Äôt like doing.

author: versacek9
body:
I‚Äôm so glad to hear this! They need you and they love you more than anything. You are their person and they would be lost without you. 

My little Annie bird (GCC small parrot) got me through it when I wanted to give up and end it all. My mom actually got her for me because she knew how hopelessly depressed I was. 

The little snugs and the way she looks into my eyes and just knowing that she needed me and she‚Äôs bonded to me and she‚Äôd be devestated without me was the only thing that kept me going. 

Some days it still is‚ÄîI‚Äôll have panic attacks and when I‚Äôd be seriously contemplating hanging myself in the closet, I go sit with my birds (I later got a second one) and they both clamor to me and look intensely into my eyes and they start trying to talk to me..

They always remind me that I can‚Äôt leave them. 

I‚Äôm really glad you have that consistency in your life too. They make all the difference in the world.

author: versacek9
body: You know, I‚Äôve been feeling like my memories haven‚Äôt been as sharp (26F/Chronic Depression), but I had just chalked it up to the substance abuse.

author: versacek9
body:
Cats are so smart, they  know the difference between a house pet bird and an outside bird. 

My family cat would continue to bring home birds but wouldn‚Äôt dare touch ours (: Yell at the cat once for trying, and he‚Äôll never do it again. 

One time I forgot to put Annie away while visiting my parents and we went out to dinner, when we came home she on perched on the back of the couch with the cat napping on the couch directly in front of her.

author: versacek9
body:
You taking the time to write this really helped me. I‚Äôve never read a statement that mirrored how I felt inside to an exact tee. 

Thank you for sharing your story‚Äîand honestly, while I was reading that you may have been down on yourself, but I thought you were impressive! 300k in savings and you have your own house? That‚Äôs awesome man. 

The fact that you‚Äôre financially set and still unhappy helped me realize that it isn‚Äôt what I lack that is making me unhappy, it‚Äôs just how I was designed as a human and I think that helped my healing process.

author: versacek9
body:
Yeah I think the people being paid can extend the olive branch first as opposed to the people being held against their will being expected to respect the people disrespecting them.

I think I‚Äôm justified in describing my situation however I see fit, thanks.

author: versacek9
body:
Yup. And it was an LLC‚Äîa single title business owner. 

It was a for profit situation and I‚Äôm disgusted I was taken advantage of and I refuse to pay that bill because it was involuntary. That seems entirely un-American to me. 

After charging the fuck out of my insurance I still owe over $700 which I‚Äôm just not going to pay. I didn‚Äôt consent to that bill.

author: versacek9
body:
Mine didn‚Äôt either, they drove me for an hour out of town in an ambulance to charge the fuck out of my insurance and now I have debt collectors have me. 

Shits fucked yo. 

That entire experience taught me if I was going to  try to kill myself again, to make sure I succeeded.

author: versacek9
body: Just be grateful you didn‚Äôt end up in the looney bin. I had same experience with intentional Zoloft OD, but I ended up in the psych ward where I was treated like less than a person for a full 72 hours.

author: versacek9
body:
Wow‚Äîliving in a country that prioritized your well-being over profit? What‚Äôs that like? 

I‚Äôm very happy for you‚Äîthat place messes you up long term, and especially with you (I‚Äôm assuming) being a teen‚Äîthat‚Äôs especially considerate of them to be gentle with you. 

In the psych ward, they‚Äôd slam open the doors to your room every 15 minutes. For 72 hours. Day and night. And then they treat you like you‚Äôre irrational and you don‚Äôt matter when you‚Äôre upset about lack of sleep. A nurse asked me what was wrong as I was marching to the nurses station at 5am after being rudely woken up by staff for a blood test for my roommate‚Äîand after I told her, she just replied ‚Äúhmm!‚Äù With a condescending, pouty face. That‚Äôs the attitude nearly all the nurses had‚Äîand the male nurses were surprisingly a lot more compassionate than the female ones. 

It was like the women got off on belittling you at every opportunity.  It‚Äôs been over a year since my experience (I‚Äôm 26F) and I‚Äôm still jaded from that experience. 

Fuck them if they think I‚Äôm going to pay them for that experience. 

Sorry I‚Äôm ranting. I‚Äôm really glad you‚Äôre safe and you were treated respectfully, please don‚Äôt take that for granted. 

It‚Äôs horribly daunting when the medical staff doesn‚Äôt care about your well being.

author: versacek9
body:
Growing up, I didn‚Äôt have a mom or female figure for guidance‚ÄîI was a tomboy and I was my Dad‚Äôs sidekick. I never got help with how to handle my emotions, I was always treated like I was annoying, I never got help with boys or my emotions and I didn‚Äôt learn how to do make up until I was 21. 

As a girl, you feel like an alien and a failure not knowing how to be a girl‚Äîyou feel out of place, you don‚Äôt know how to communicate and befriend other girls, yet you can never be one of the boys.

As an adult‚Äîmy main career interests are in fields that don‚Äôt have happen to have a lot of women (electrical maintenance) and the amount of pure distain and resistance I receive from numerous men in this line of work‚Äîit‚Äôs horrific. 

I know insecurities are loud, but their constant remarks meant to belittle me wear down my self esteem and makes me want to surrender and become a receptionist even though I‚Äôm damn good at my job and am better than many of the guys I work with‚Äîit doesn‚Äôt matter if I pursue my actual interests or how good I happen to be at it, I can‚Äôt handle the negativity and the constant demand to prove myself and always reminding myself not to get too comfortable. 

It‚Äôs exhausting, it‚Äôs not simply about bettering myself‚ÄîI‚Äôm a fraud no matter what I do. 

I agree looks are an awful construct of society‚ÄîI think it‚Äôs ironic that it‚Äôs rude to stare at an ugly person, but it‚Äôs a compliment to stare at an attractive person. Staring is rude in general and there shouldn‚Äôt be such a bias about surface representation.

author: versacek9
body:
If you‚Äôre attractive, you get social anxiety from people staring at you and you retain your depression from feeling guilty that you‚Äôre not happy even though you‚Äôre above average in looks. 

You start to hate yourself because you realize every job interview you ever landed was just because you‚Äôre pretty, you don‚Äôt actually have anything of substance to offer. 

People make reserved judgements about you that you must be conceited and treat you poorly or take every opportunity to make a jab at your self esteem, lowering your confidence with each remark and making you want to hide from the world. 

And then you live with the crippling realization that you‚Äôre only getting older and your looks will be gone by your mid-30s and you have to feel insecure at every younger girl your partner looks at.

And it‚Äôs the worse feeling when you get as pretty and glammed up as you can, but it does nothing for you internally. You still feel empty and you ruin your hour-long make up ritual with tears of inadequacy. 

I was much happier before people convinced me I was attractive.

EDIT: but I agree, being able to get out of tickets by crying definitely makes life easier.

author: versacek9
body: Nah, she only rocks Dolce & Gabbana

author: versacek9
body:
I do have a dog. She gets uncomfortable by our (me and boyfriend) fights and usually leaves us alone until it resolves. 

She‚Äôs a huge sweetheart, just very independent.

I have two small parrots who love me unconditionally and need me‚Äîthat keeps me going I think.

author: versacek9
body:
1) Don‚Äôt start. You do it to be edgy and you do feel a little better and tougher‚Äîbut it gets addicting because when you no longer have others‚Äô compassion to distract you from self loathing‚Äîyou have pain that can distract you from your sadness. 

2) The ankles, that‚Äôs where I started years ago. Doesn‚Äôt bleed too much. Light slices leave light scars that fade. 

3) When my ankles were too cut up, I moved to my wrists. I now wear sweaters in 80¬∞F on walks with friends so they won‚Äôt see. They take a long time to heal and the scars don‚Äôt go away on your forearms. I‚Äôm thinking of a getting a sleeve to cover them up. 

4) please just don‚Äôt cut yourself. I understand why it helps, but it‚Äôs so embarrassing to hide from loved ones or explain to doctors. 

Please try snapping your wrist with a rubber band instead or digging your fingernails into your palm. 

Please be good to yourself. You‚Äôre really all you have at the end of the day, so I‚Äôm realizing. 

I‚Äôve given up, but I have hope for you. Please don‚Äôt start. It starts at a curiosity but ends in more self hatred.

author: versacek9
body: I want to die just so people will be like ‚Äúoh wow, she really was sad.‚Äù

author: versacek9
body:
2 little parrots who make me feel guilty when I feel this way. My mom called me right as I was about to do it and let me cry to her. 

I couldn‚Äôt tell her what I was about to do because I don‚Äôt want to get set back to the psych ward.

author: versacek9
body: I‚Äôm going to try to hang myself in my closet so my pets won‚Äôt see, and jump from a high enough object so that my neck will hopefully crack and I can‚Äôt just struggle out it.

author: versacek9
body:
As someone who has attempted suicide, don‚Äôt do it‚Äîthe involuntary psychiatric hold you get placed on is NOT WORTH IT. 

You need to work on your vibe bud, as a depressed empath, I know how hard that is‚Äîbut if your dog is avoiding you, you must be a bummer to be around (and I don‚Äôt mean that in a mean way, just observatory) and it‚Äôs draining for others to handle. 

You should try to work on just trying to make your dog‚Äôs day‚Äîjust give him a special walk or go on a jog or go to the beach/lake and then get him an ice cream or special treat. Just give him the best dog day of his/her life and relish in his pure joy. You‚Äôll feel better about yourself, that you created happiness for him and he‚Äôll share it with you

author: versacek9
body: Can I come

author: versacek9
body: I feel like saying that undermines conventionally ‚Äúattractive‚Äù people with depression. Like ‚Äúhere‚Äôs another reason to feel bad about yourself‚Äîyou‚Äôre good looking and you‚Äôre still depressed, you ungrateful, useless piece of shit‚Äù.

author: versacek9
body:
This doesn‚Äôt really go away. I‚Äôm 26 and I still feel 16. Just a 16 year old with experience. 

I think the lasts into adulthood until you realize you‚Äôre old and you can‚Äôt pretend to be young anymore. My dad said he felt like he was 25 until he was 55.

author: versacek9
body: I keep trying to strangle myself, or block off blood flow so I pass out, using a doorknob but I keep violently gagging.

author: versacek9
body: Good to know

author: versacek9
body: I like being friends with depressed people. They have the funniest sense of humor. I also might be biased because I have chronic depression.

author: versacek9
body:
People are naturally uncomfortable around sick people‚Äîany kind of disability, it‚Äôs human nature, don‚Äôt hold it against them. 

My parents and brother know I‚Äôve tried to kill myself and ended up in a psych ward and they couldn‚Äôt say much either. There really isn‚Äôt much to say‚Äîit‚Äôs a battle between you and yourself. It‚Äôs unfair to ask someone else to take on the weight of your disability and fix you, it‚Äôs not only unfair for them, but it‚Äôs impossible. I‚Äôm sorry, but it‚Äôs true. 

They care and they hurt for you, but empathy is exhausting especially to this extent‚Äîthat‚Äôs why it‚Äôs important to find a licensed professional who knows how to handle your extremes. More than that, you need to accept that the only person who can fix you is you‚Äîit‚Äôs a choice to want to get better and I know how impossible that feels.  

It‚Äôs not your fault you feel this way and it‚Äôs not your family‚Äôs fault for not reacting how you think they should have‚Äîthat‚Äôs called entitlement and it‚Äôs a toxic feature for your brain to focus on.  That being said, that doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôre not worthy of love and compassion, but it‚Äôs difficult to attract positivity (no matter how badly you might need it) when you‚Äôre stuck as Eeyore (the depressed Donkey from Winnie the Pooh). 

The best you can hope for right at this moment, is for your to family accept you for the sad little raincloud you are and continues to love you unconditionally. It‚Äôs up to you to help yourself. 

I‚Äôm sorry bud, I hope you feel better.

author: versacek9
body:
You will find friends who know how you are and will love you anyways. I didn‚Äôt think it was possible until I found them.  They know I‚Äôm depressed, they know I have social anxiety, they know I prefer to stay home, but they still invite me out and they know it means a lot if I make an effort to go out and even then, they don‚Äôt expect me to have a good time or enjoy it. 

It‚Äôs literally like Pooh Bear and his whole gang. They invite Eeyore out anyways, even though they know he won‚Äôt enjoy it and he‚Äôll be bummed, they‚Äôre just happy to have him included. 

I promise you will. You just have to be real with them, they‚Äôll understand. And if they don‚Äôt, then why would you keep making effort and putting yourself in uncomfortable positions for people who don‚Äôt care?

author: versacek9
body:
I use to feel like this. From like 8-24. 

Getting a job you enjoy helps a lot. It gives you a sense of purpose and makes you feel valuable.

author: versacek9
body:
Something will happen that will make you sick of feeling this way. It could be traumatic, it could be gradual, but you‚Äôll get tired of depression being your only confidant. 

It‚Äôs completely possibly to channel the person you were before depression (or before you knew you had it) and pick up where you left off. 

You might have to accept you‚Äôll never be completely rid of your depression. I have a form of chronic depression and I‚Äôve had a few therapists tell me it‚Äôs a part of my personality and my only option is to learn how to live with it‚Äîwhich was initially discouraging to hear, but it doesn‚Äôt mean you have to feel like this all the time. 

After accepting the cards you‚Äôve been dealt, you can learn how to manage them. It takes time and eventually the depression becomes easier to manage. 

It‚Äôs really just like that one comic strip where the girl has a big mean wolf (depression) who always stalked her and would attack her randomly and he kept her from doing things‚Äîand it wasn‚Äôt until she had enough of his shit and starting to fight back that the wolf shrank in size and became more docile. The wolf still acted out from time to time, because it was a wolf and that‚Äôs what wolves do, but they grew to have a respectful relationship where they coexist together. 

And it does feel like that. It feels like my depression will go away when I need it to. And sometimes stuff builds up or something bad happens and I sink back into it. But it doesn‚Äôt last as long.

author: versacek9
body: Be careful about saying shit like that. That‚Äôs how you get thrown in a psych ward.

author: versacek9
body:
Unfortunately, the therapist is correct. 

You have to accept your depression for what is and decide you don‚Äôt want to feel that way anymore. I know that sounds cliche, but as someone who was diagnosed with chronic depression and major depression‚Äîit‚Äôs true. 

Nobody is going to fix it for you. 

What helped me was Zoloft. I was on it for two years, it taught me how to relax and stop caring about things. I‚Äôve been off of it for a year and the lessons that drug taught me remain the same, I know how to relax better than I did before. 

The depression is still there, it‚Äôs never going to go away. Chronic depression becomes a part of your personality, you grew up with it and your mind literally doesn‚Äôt know how to function without it. But it‚Äôs possible to control it, and when you take charge and decide you don‚Äôt like feeling like this anymore, the depression backs down and works with you. 

Depression is a part of you, but it doesn‚Äôt have to control you. You two can exist mutually in the same space, you take turns occupying your headspace. 

My depression leaves me alone for the most part and it mostly comes out on a daily basis as cynical humor. I still get deep depression episodes occasionally, but that‚Äôs okay. I let my depression have its moment, I hide from the world and stay in bed, and it does it‚Äôs thing and then I can I move onto the thing. 

Depression is like having a shitty roommate.

author: versacek9
body:
I tried to do this. I ended up in a psych ward. Wasn‚Äôt worth it. They put you back on the same stuff you tried to kill yourself with. 

The entire experience was belittling and insulting. 

Just eat something that you know you‚Äôll enjoy and take a nap. Fuck everything else for right now.

author: versacek9
body: I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll lose your job. A) that‚Äôs personal/medical, your job isn‚Äôt entitled to that information that just transpired. Plus B) depression is a disability, they can‚Äôt fire you for a disability.

author: versacek9
body:
Yes, if you don‚Äôt take responsibility and use your wellness hours and get it cleared with your work then yeah, missing work will get anyone fired. 

Medical leave needs to be cleared with your work, that‚Äôs what depressive episodes are categorized as.

author: vvvrrrttt
body: Sometimes I wonder if depression is actually just a trait of some type of different person. Like wouldn't it be plausible that there are pessimist and optimists both in the world? But no. The pessimistic side of humans is deemed mentally ill. And I'm not denying that it is, because honestly it is just terrible, depression is terrible. But just removing that aspect, is it because "sadness" is not meant to be felt in society? Well, no. Maybe in the past but I do believe people have gotten a lot better expressing themselves and opening up about this, but I do agree and ask why. I don't believe happiness is a mental illness, more like a societal mood that should be expressed and fit in line. But I feel like if you aren't happy or satisifed you just fall out of that line.

author: vvvrrrttt
body: I'd assume judgement, fear, desperate for people to tolerate me, societal issues, family.

he yells at me in front of my team. and makes me feel
extremely dumb during training. i don‚Äôt think he‚Äôll understand.

author: xxmilktea
body:
some guy that was mentoring me basically told my manager that i left work early. she trusted him and didn‚Äôt trust me, and gave me a lecture. i was extremely confused since i didn‚Äôt leave work early. i talked to her and found out that i left during lunch (which were allowed to do) but she didn‚Äôt ask him questions and trusted him based on seniority. all he does is play on his stupid phone and get credit for everything. 

since then my life has sucked. he created a lack of trust and i feel extremely paranoid and watched. almost
scared of management. it‚Äôs probably my anxiety and my depression but i just don‚Äôt think i can deal with it anymore. i can‚Äôt work for a company that choices to take sides with someone based on seniority when i do all his work and get beat up over it.

author: xxmilktea
body: that‚Äôs so amazing how you‚Äôve changed your life! i‚Äôm so proud of the effort you‚Äôve made. please do well and take care of yourself! eat better, get some exercise, anything to boost your serotonin levels. <3

author: xxmilktea
body: of course! please stay strong and take care of yourself. you‚Äôve made it this far!!! you can do it! proud of you!

author: xxmilktea
body: awe, that‚Äôs amazing youre getting help! it just reminded me that there are a lot of anxiety behaviors (physical) - for me i tend to shake my leg a lot. most of these professionals are trained to read behaviors too! seriously so proud of you for getting help, stay strong you‚Äôre never alone.

author: xxmilktea
body: makes me happy that you are hopeful. i believe in you! when you‚Äôre ready i know you‚Äôll find help. <3 stay strong.

author: xxmilktea
body: still! means a lot even if it‚Äôs one person. i‚Äôm going to try to do my best to reply to as many people as i can, because one person can change anything. just like you <3!

author: xxmilktea
body: i know how hard it is, but keep trying to find the right doctor. i went through a lot of therapist and psychiatrist before finding the best one for me. it should be someone you trust and you can open up to. life is beautiful and precious, and you are too.

author: xxmilktea
body: of course it‚Äôs my pleasure. please try it! also there‚Äôs some research that diets can help too, specifically omega-3 fatty acids (salmon is big on this)! try to eat healthier and go outside for a walk! these were some recommendations from my therapist. not sure if you like animals since they aren‚Äôt cheap, but i have an emotional support dog and he makes me feel really loved. animals truly love their pack more than themselves.

author: xxmilktea
body: i actually felt this way and after getting treatment i realized it was all in my head. is there any reason why you can‚Äôt get professional assistance? i did therapy for two years, once a week and it didn‚Äôt do justice due to my prognosis but medication has helped me so much.

author: xxmilktea
body: you‚Äôre welcome! also saw what you posted on the comments above. but rapid weight gain and loss would be a good physical change, as well as dark circles or swollen eyes (crying/no sleep). also, you could probably see cuts on them, but most people tend to hide this! hope this is useful. and also want to add i‚Äôm not a professional, but this is my from my own experience. :)

author: xxmilktea
body: hi there! i‚Äôm sorry there aren‚Äôt many options in your area. if you have an iphone there are apps where you can talk to a psychiatrist or doctor. also, my therapist recommended for me to wear a hat that also gives me UV lights to lighten up my mood. i believe there are some on amazon. if you need help finding it please just let me know and i‚Äôll try my best to help.

author: xxmilktea
body: most people who are extremely happy or make people laugh tend to be depressed. but there really aren‚Äôt visual signs, mostly actions and behaviors.

author: xxmilktea
body: i‚Äôm so sorry you feel this way; my heart is honestly broken for you and this really made me want to cry. but please stay for her.  from my perspective i love my mom so much and if she felt this way i would be devastated. i‚Äôd blame myself for not giving her joy, and if i‚Äôm being honest i probably would hurt myself over it too. please seek medical help, and do whatever you can to be better for her. if you need help finding doctors/therapist/psychiatrist. please contact me and i will do whatever i can you assist. be strong please.
